website_summaries.verdict: The Zune 120, with a unique focus on music discovery, is a fierce competitor to the iPod Classic. The Zune's substantial storage capacity combined with its Zune Pass music subscription makes it an ideal solution for restless music fans with large appetites.
pros: The 120GB Microsoft Zune MP3 player has expanded the usefulness of its Wi-Fi and social music-discovery features, added support for games and audiobooks, and maintained enviable features, such as a 3.2-inch glass LCD, friendly interface, exceptional navigation control, audio- and video-podcast support, superlative FM radio, wireless syncing, good audio quality, and a built-in composite-video output
cons: high-quality earbuds are no longer included
the glossy plastic front is more prone to scratches and smudges
and using many of the new features without a Zune Pass music subscription can be disappointing

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as gift for the husband to replace his other one that died and I was worried about buying a used one, I didn't want it to arrive all damaged and looking used. But when I received it, it was packaged nicely in a small box the zune was wrapped in bubble wrap and it came with a charger and earbuds. No scratches or marks anywhere. It is a gift so it hasn't been charged and turned on yet to see if it actually works, but I don't see why it wouldn't judging from the outside appearance of it. So far I'm very pleased and even more so that I saved over 200.00 buying used instead of new
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Great, But...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this Zune for about 6 months now, and I have been completely satisfied. However, I did have to return my first one to Microsoft because it had a small crack underneath the play button. Me being my Obsessive Compulsive self, I needed to have the product in perfect condition. After I received the new Zune Microsoft (their service is incredibly easy to navigate for the Zunes by the way) I purchased afor an incredibly good price and I have not had any problems with it since then. Overall, I would recommend this product to friends because of it's beautiful screen, large capacity, and ease of support services from Microsoft.
customer_reviews.author: Jens CK Trauntvein

customer_reviews.title: Wish I'd tried a different device
customer_reviews.text: Liked it at first, but have really grown to dislike it overtime. The primary reason is the clunky Zune software. With 120gb of space a much better way of organizing material is needed. A simple file system would do it. Instead, one has to scroll through gigabytes of songs to try to find the one they want. The touch pad is also prone to mistakes which can land one back at the start after scrolling around for "days" to get someplace. Give me a file and folder system. Run the Zune style scheme over that. As it stands no one in our household even really uses the Zune. We all prefer other players.
customer_reviews.author: JOrth

customer_reviews.title: The Dream is Dead
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was hanging onto a dream of when I used to use my old zune player heavily but it just never worked right. I even sent it back to the place that I bought it from and he sent it back to me but it only worked for a week then died on me again. So I just didn't bother.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love my Zune
customer_reviews.text: I know everyone else has switched from the Zune; they don't even make software for it anymore! But I still love my Zune and am not ready to give her up. I went with the traditional Zune, not the HDTV. I also opted for the big storage. That is why I'm not awarding 5 stars. It won't charge anymore, which is really a disappointment. I want to fix it, and still won't move to a newer system. I am loyal to a fault. UPDATE: Three years later, the Zune decided to charge again and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Dani Branch

customer_reviews.title: This is my second Zune
customer_reviews.text: My first Zune has lasted me many years (at least 8) of using it daily, but it is now losing its charge quicker, so I decided to get a new one. I am very happy with my second Zune so far, but I am writing this review more because of the company I purchased it from--Duciespade LLC. The first one they sent had a problem--it happens. This company worked with me and were very nice to work with. They are not naïve, but were willing to listen and make it right. We came to an agreement to satisfy both parties and I would gladly buy from them again. Thank you, Duciespade LLC!
customer_reviews.author: D'arcy White

customer_reviews.title: I found it easier to use than an ipod
customer_reviews.text: I love the Zune. i find it very easy to use and the Zune software for your PC is much better than itunes. It has never locked up my PC (itunes does) and it loads very quickly (itunes does not). It cost far less than an ipod and holds much more. I use mine as a permanent fixture on top of my stereo. It is big but I don't care about portability. I like the extra big screen for the way I use it. If you want something that you are going to carry in your pocket you may want the ipod instead because it is much smaller.
customer_reviews.author: a guy in U.S.A.

customer_reviews.title: The Zune is in very good shape. Not a scratch on it
customer_reviews.text: The Zune is in very good shape. Not a scratch on it. Too bad the Zune has no EQ though. It's not the sellers fault. I now rate this seller as a top seller. 5 stars! Update, the headphones suck, and one of them is not working, but no big deal to me. Still and very nice Zune.
customer_reviews.author: C B

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I dislike that this Zune 120 GB MP3 Player stopped working after 6 months. I did get a 32 GB HD as a replacement that still works great. A close friend of mine bought his a month prior to me and his did the same thing. What sucks, is he got a 16 GB HD as a replacement. Sucks that he can only put 30% of his music on it.
customer_reviews.author: Craig S. Comb

customer_reviews.title: Eh....
customer_reviews.text: It was pretty great, and I really liked it while it lasted. 3 days after the 1 year warranty expired, it gave me an error message, which as I learned after calling Microsoft, indicated a catastrophic hard drive failure. So, it bricked. I guess I can't be angry, since at least it lasted through the warranty period, but my 3rd Generation iPod Touch is over four years old, has suffered a cracked screen and dent on the back, and is still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Duarte Costeira

customer_reviews.title: Love it, Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have had 3 other MP3 players before this one, and I may never buy another player. I have had this one for a few years now and other than the scratches on the screen (my Fault) the player works as good today as the day i bought it. I work 12 hours a day and the battery always makes it through the day. It is easy to load and best of all if you loose your music on your computer you can download it from your player, which I had to do when my computer crashed.
customer_reviews.author: W. White

customer_reviews.title: Great MP3
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed this MP3 Player. Easy to drop on Pics, Movies, and Songs after you get use to the program. You have to use WIN Avi to minimize movies to put on this player. A full size movie is the wrong format. The Zune is fast, no hesitations while flipping between songs. The Zune program for your computer was easier to use than i-Pods program and it accepted two songs on it that my i-Pod did not accept. (don't know why it wasn't accepted on the i-Pod, tried many times) I would HIGHLY recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: CoastinG

customer_reviews.title: music on the go
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product and I really liked my expectation filled the qualify because everything arrived as requested I really I liked all the pretty enough to recommend to all the community through Amazon not change. would recommend vendor to other to purchase their much needed items, i really like the service and the products that i have received.
customer_reviews.author: John  Moses

customer_reviews.title: Love my new Zune 120!
customer_reviews.text: I just got my new Zune 120 and I love it! I have the red one and it looks great. I like the big screen and the intuitive menu/navigation. While I don't have enough music to warrant getting a 120 gb device, I did so because the 120 was less expensive than some of the smaller versions. I also like that it allowed me to sync my entire music selection to it, which iPod isn't compatible with all file formats. The only issue, other than the low quality headphones, is that the Radio feature doesn't work that well inside our house, but it works just fine outside. I am glad I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: New Cook

customer_reviews.title: Broke within two months
customer_reviews.text: I am a person that takes very good care of my things, especially electronics. I decided to get this Zune because my best friend highly recommended it and this made it easy to share music with her. I only used maybe 10 GB before the Zune quit working. It would make this awful clicking sound inside and overheat. I never once dropped it or left it outside. Never could get it to work again. I usually don't care for Apple products, but I will stick with my iPod.
customer_reviews.author: AdriMarie

customer_reviews.title: husbands zune
customer_reviews.text: Zune is still working and would like to find another, good item
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good MP3 player!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my older Creative Zen player with the Zune 120 Gig model. I love my new mp3 player. I don't think it's lacking anything. The controls are easy to use and the sound quality is great too. I am using a pair of Sony noise cancellation ear buds. The video and picture quality are also very nice. I would recommend it to anyone. UPDATE: The battery does not hold a charge anymore. This has happened just after a year and a half of use. Had to pay a lot to get a new battery from a third party vendor. UPDATE: Player completely died after year and a half of use. Bringing down rating to 2 stars now.
customer_reviews.author: Syed S. Kamal

customer_reviews.title: a great gift
customer_reviews.text: A birthday gift for my daughter. She requested this particular model to go with her Xbox 360. Apparently it plugs and plays her music so she doesnt have to listen to the game music. I chose the 120 because she had a Creative Zen that was 30gb and was shifting and rotating music so I decided it would be nice for something bigger for her to not have to rotate music from her computer as often. She has taken great interest in all it can do and has a blast with it.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Hard Drive crashed very quickly
customer_reviews.text: I'm a long time Zune user. Still have my 30 Gig which works great. Bought one with a bad hard drive, got it replaced without incident. Got the replacement, had it for about 2 weeks and it crashed. Rebooted it, re-installed everything, and it did it again. Now, it won't do anything. Hard drive is dead. Love my 30 Gig, wouldn't buy another 120 gig.
customer_reviews.author: Dakotah T Questelle

customer_reviews.title: Zune Players 30gb to 120 gb
customer_reviews.text: I have bought multiple Zunes, 30gb, 80gb, and 120gb and they have died on me. One froze up on way to work this morning. I loved their ease of operation and setting up but I can't keep paying this type of money for players that will die on me. I will try another product but I have seen bad review on them also - I just haven't invested hundreds of dollars on them yet.
customer_reviews.author: Lola L. Cabaniss

customer_reviews.title: Lovin my new Zune!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! #3 120g Zune use it all the time. GREAT PRODUCT, TERRIFIC SELLER, Fast shipping!
customer_reviews.author: Don Mankow

customer_reviews.title: NICE UNIT
customer_reviews.text: Since I would rather watch videos on my 50" Samsung instead of the Zune screen, my use is primarily for music. It took a while for me to learn how to download my collection. Fortunately, there are many Zune sites to help. Microsoft wasn't particularly one of them, but I managed to find out how to navigate the Zune. I recommend the Zune to any anti-IPOD person, but it would be nice if there were more third-party accessories like the IPOD has.
customer_reviews.author: RGZ

customer_reviews.title: garbage / 2 zunes in 2 years
customer_reviews.text: had (emphasis on had) and (was) great warranty associated with this product,when it fried the first time, unsure why the problem, sent product in and recd back w/in 1 week, great service, good sound quality, a lot of room for movies and songs, great screen 9/2/2011 zune fried again and warranty is up, this is my 2nd device in 2 years and now they want 119.00 to fix w/o warranty. I wont buy this again, I will buy another product all together
customer_reviews.author: Trrampage

customer_reviews.title: Not to good.
customer_reviews.text: The bad part is that the Zune products are not really made any more through Dell and trying to get a decent one is not looking to great. This one had a crack at the bottom and it tends to freezes once in a while which is not good. But since there is not many 120 GB MP3 Players out there, then you are just stuck with whatever is available. Plus, I hate the Ipods.
customer_reviews.author: S.J

customer_reviews.title: Zune is Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I was pondering getting an IPod, but after looking at both, I thought the Zune was better, and more user friendly. There's no need to "convert" all my files to IPod format; mp3's are directly loaded! I've loaded it with photos, videos, audio books, and ALL of my music! I take it to work and play it low with simple speakers while working, and it makes my day go so much better! I can even listen to my favorite radio show in the morning. LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.author: H. C. Keith

customer_reviews.title: Durable and reliable and stands up to abuse.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Zune back in 2010, and it still is going strong. This Zune has been to Afghanistan with me on 2 deployments, and has been thrown around, beaten and abused, and it is still perfect, I have no issues with it. I have a case on it, and a screen protector that no doubt helped, but I absolutely love this mp3 player.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: I Love My Zune
customer_reviews.text: I have had this Zune for 9-10 months and I absolutely love it. I've had not problems with it and it has the perfect amount of space. I have well over 60 gigs of music in my collection that is constantly growing and about 30 gigs of movies. This coupled with the A/V charger and docking station are great. The only thing I wish the Zune had was an equalizer in its settings, but that's the audio tech in me being critical.
customer_reviews.author: L. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Crashed after a month
customer_reviews.text: Everything was as described I just didn't know how terrible a refurbished hard drive could be. Zunes should be considered dead : (
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm lovin my zune 120gb
customer_reviews.text: I am really enjoying my Zune. It has been easy to use and I have had no software problems yet. I have had it for a week and have about 35gb of music pics etc.. on it. I just wish the zune pass had more to offer like actually allowing you to pay to download a movie like itunes. Other than that the zune pass is just ok. Don't think I'll pay the 15 monthly to continue to use that. All in all I love my zune. It's better than an ipod to me!!
customer_reviews.author: Armywife

customer_reviews.title: Zune 120
customer_reviews.text: This is the only mp3 I've owned, so I have nothing to compare it against. I've used this for a couple of years now and enjoy the music. I occasionally have a problem navigating, but this is due to my lack of experience with mp3's rather than the player itself. Using Zune.com for my collection has likewise been easy as far as downloading, uploading, and synching between the two.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Gerhardt

customer_reviews.title: Zune 120
customer_reviews.text: Had a Zune 30 for several years. It quit working. Got the Zune 120, and I love it. I work out everyday, so I use it for that. Plus I have episodes of Monk installed on it and other videos, so if I have to wait somewhere, doctors office, airport, etc, I have something to watch for entertainment. Love my Zune! Nice size screen for the videos too. All my pictures are on it too, so I can bore people with those.
customer_reviews.author: Lelowe

customer_reviews.title: Only device for me!
customer_reviews.text: While I no longer own this item due to an untimely, accidental crushing of the screen which resulted in it being completely unusable, this Zune model had me blown away in the month that I did have it. Having owned 2 iPod Nanos (1st & 3rd generation) and the Video (5th Generation), I can honestly say without bias that Microsoft's product is the better buy. The quality headphones. The wireless syncing. The lack of frozen screen episodes and inclusion of stellar battery life. The radio. I especially like the interface of the software better compared to iTunes. It's much easier adding the files you want. Definitely buying a new one when I save up.
customer_reviews.author: Roseann White

customer_reviews.title: Old tech so there really isn't much use for it anymore
customer_reviews.text: Old tech, and alot of services don't work anymore. The zune marketplace is dead, and you can't really sync purchased music from Xbox either. It really hard to add audiobooks, and ever harder to listen to them Doesn't make sense to buy anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Manish Chawla

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was great while it lasted. Malfunctioned and ceased to work after a year and a half.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: WASNT DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: Even though ZUNE is no longer making MP3 players choosing to focus on the phone market. I purchased this as a back up hard drive for all my music. ZUNE does still offer support for their products. I bought a refurbished model. I recommend purchasing from a qualified seller vs personal transactions with a individual seller
customer_reviews.author: Tyrone D

customer_reviews.title: Item was a refurbished model
customer_reviews.text: Item was a refurbished model and was a pitiful sample of refurbishment! Not only did the harddrive start skipping but they repairman told me the battery was bad and needed to be replaced! I think they must have skipped this one and slipped it in for sale without fixing anything! I will not buy refurbished again and I will not buy from this dealer again either. I had to spend $200 more to repair everything when I had it less than a month! Lesson learned!
customer_reviews.author: Songbird

customer_reviews.title: great little player
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't decide between the Zune and the ipod but finally chose the Zune because of the radio option and screen size. I'm really glad I did too! Both my daughters have ipods and the their screens seem really small to me. I use the radio option a lot too. I've even downloaded audio books, movies, etc. My only complaint is there aren't very many accessories available for it.
customer_reviews.author: K. L.

customer_reviews.title: The Best MP3 Player out there
customer_reviews.text: I've had my 120gb model for over 2 months now and have loved it. I also own a 30gb model (purchased April 2007) that I outgrew, and since given to the wife. I was so impressed with the older model that I did not think twice about buying an ipod instead of a Zune. It's a far superior product in my opinion. Every person I know that has owned an ipod has had to have it replaced because it was broken. I've never once had an issue with either of my Zunes. The screen is large, crisp and clear. I LOVE the radio feature. This really is an all in one device.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kramer

customer_reviews.title: loved this! Now just wish the site was still ...
customer_reviews.text: loved this! Now just wish the site was still going.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley L. Raney

customer_reviews.title: wish these were still a thing!
customer_reviews.text: 7 years later and this guy still works like a champ! I'd recommend it...but they dont take em and your phone is probably just as good. I am pretty pissed that Microsoft killed all support for them and I can't even connect it up to a windows 8 computer
customer_reviews.author: Kevin T

customer_reviews.title: Music while you deer hunt
customer_reviews.text: Jeez, times have changed! Years ago, I would hunt with a cassette player (later a CD player) and would have just a few songs to listen to. Now I carry 7900+ songs and a couple of hundred podcasts in a package that is smaller than either of those old clunky rigs. What I really like is the songlist feature. I can stack hours of music and have a great hunt. The battery lasts all day. The only thing I would like is a "podlist" function so I could stack them too.
customer_reviews.author: K. Springs

customer_reviews.title: The Zune Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I have owened a Zune 30 GB for about 2 1/2 years. I decided to upgrade because I was getting hooked to all the music I was getting from Zune pass and couldnt fit it all on my 30 GB. I love this thing more then any of the other MP3 players or digital players I have owned. I gave the old 30 gig to my wife, bought a 120 gig and a 4 gig for running and am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great Player... Great Design... Much Better Than iPod
customer_reviews.text: Pro's: - beautiful screen - very nice zune pad control - high contrast video - easy transfer of songs - simple software - background is interchangeable - zune channels gives you a great mix of music - great compatibility with music formats - large hard drive space Con's - video compatibility needs a little work - better battery would be nice (still great though) - standard headphones (same as iPod quality)
customer_reviews.author: Hi-C

customer_reviews.title: The best media player
customer_reviews.text: I've had this since it released and it's still running strong. I get around 12 hours of battery life for music, the sound quality is great, and the software is very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Me Love Zune!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, I love my Zune, and thanks to the thieves where I live, I had to actually save up money to buy a new one, since MS has forsaken us in light of the fruit-based company. My life is now complete again now that I have a replacement MP3 player for the one I never in my life thought anyone would steal.
customer_reviews.author: CDM

customer_reviews.title: Love the Zune
customer_reviews.text: I love the Zune. This one with the huge hard drive is fabulous. This one is the third I've bought since getting my own. Now I have given 2 as gifts with all my music (60 gigs) loaded onto them and both of my music nut friends couldn't be happier. Just like me. Only con is that the FM radio reception isn't really great and I use radio a lot. But all in all the Zune 120 gig is AWESOME. Way better than IPOD and better graphics and user interface.
customer_reviews.author: Mezzo Tint

customer_reviews.title: I miss the zune.
customer_reviews.text: The MS Zune was my favorite mp3 player it was a great device with a perfect UI. Also the MS market place was designed better and functioned much better than even the latest version of iTunes.
customer_reviews.author: William B.

customer_reviews.title: I love Zune . . . So much better than Ipod
customer_reviews.text: I love the Zune for all the features it has and the fact that it is NOT an IPOD. I have actually figured out a way to place and watch movies on it. That discovery was the most wonderful aspect of the whole purchase and user experience. I would recommend the Zune to anyone. The touch buton takes a little getting used to and it picks up fingerprints VERY earliy but overall I love it.
customer_reviews.author: bookworm78

customer_reviews.title: Really good
customer_reviews.text: I brought this version as I had an 80gb zune and needed more space, the functionality is pretty good and I have no complains about it. But I brught a "refurbished" unit which turned to be a scratchy used version with no original earphones. Pay attention to what you buy and whom you by from
customer_reviews.author: Marsano

customer_reviews.title: It sounds great and I don't have to take up any space ...
customer_reviews.text: Who the heck buys a Zune in 2015?! Me! It sounds great and I don't have to take up any space on my phone for music. My old one from who knows how long ago finally stopped working and I was happy to find one still available.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Feliciano

customer_reviews.title: Bust
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 30 minutes. Had an older one and loved it until I wore it out.
customer_reviews.author: George T Slider

customer_reviews.title: I love the graphics of the Zune....however...
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty frustrated right now. Was very excited with the Zune120 GB that I got for Christmas. Downloaded all of my songs, and some video. I really liked the graphics...however after one day of use, I lost everything, got an error message. I went to the website, tried what they suggested, nothing worked. I've sent the ZUNE back to Microsoft...hopefully this is just a glitch and when I get it back will be everything I've hoped it will be.
customer_reviews.author: K. Krebs

customer_reviews.title: Love my Zune
customer_reviews.text: Value is beyond compare. Had a 32G for years & the battery started to die. It's a shame the Zune never really got "Discovered". it has been overshadowed by Apple.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gleason

customer_reviews.title: 120GB Zune
customer_reviews.text: you might as well get a couple iPOD touch 64's and call it a day. it would be worth it. I have 650 videos and movies on my iPOD and only about 40 on my zune and it took less time to get them on the iPOD than it did on the zune. no external speaker so your gonna get tired of earplugs. if your used to anything cooler your gonna wanna touch the screen to do stuff and the touch pad that controlles it sucks. I just turned to touch part off it was so bad. I really hate to say it but go with an iPOD... its so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Aden

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: this replaced my old broken 80gb zune with this 120gb zune, these are the best mp3 players in the world i'm planning on purchasing one are two more before it's to late. i also own two cowon players i like the quality of the music better on the cowons but i love the way i can move around on the zune and make playlist on the player it self.
customer_reviews.author: bear

customer_reviews.title: Sweet!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after being jealous over my friend's 80 GB zune, and immediately fell in love with it! I would say that if you can sacrifice space for further capabilities, then go for the ipod touch; if you have an immense music and video collection (like I do), then you won't want to miss this little guy.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Amazin!
customer_reviews.text: After owning 3 ipod click wheels, 2 shuffles, and 1 iPod touch, I decided to try out the Zune 120! I am SO happy with my purchase! The Zune pass is worth every penny! For $15 a month you get unlimited music downloads (that DO sync to the Zune) AND you get to choose 10 tracks to keep forever! I love my Zune! Everyone should have one!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: We really love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my hubby for Valentine's day; to replace an older Zune in which the screen was damaged (by one of our kids, no doubt.) We like the radio feature, the screen is a great size, I like the built-in games (love to play sudoku while waiting in line to get the kids from school). Compared to the iPod touch that is out there right now, I really feel this is a great value considering you get 120 GB with a screen just over 3". In other words, you have a screen big enough so you don't go cross-eyed watching video, and enough memory to actually store your fav. TV shows or whatever. Very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: A. Neppl

customer_reviews.title: I like this product...
customer_reviews.text: More than enough space for all your audio and video files. The software is fairly intuitive. If you set up parameters to suit yourself, you can keep the Zune from copying all your audio and video files and just add the content you want. The sound quality and the large screen are excellent. It is great for watching full length movies.
customer_reviews.author: Julie S

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Has to return it did not work. And they don't make this one anymore so could not replace it.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Maryland

customer_reviews.title: I Love My Zune 120GB!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Zune! It is easy to Sync wired and wirelessly. It is easy to navigate. It has tons of storage space - I've got my whole music library, some videos and movies, and a few other apps and have not made a dent yet in the storage space! I will say though, that the battery life and peformance is the only downside.
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: Bought this years ago... wish my purchase ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this years ago...wish my purchase date was here. The thing still works flawlessly. Wish MS still made Zune mp3 players
customer_reviews.author: RotorBalls

customer_reviews.title: Still the best
customer_reviews.text: I have had this device for 7 years now, never broken down or anything, it works great and I dread the day it finally dies because I don't see anything on the market that matches this product. Hopefully that's not anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota J. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: HAPPY ZUNE OWNER
customer_reviews.text: just a great product. very cool. look great. sounds very good.it takes a day or so to figure out how she works the zune pass i love an will try to keep forever almost any song or album you can think of is yours to dowload and you have 120 gb of space i would buy it AGAIN
customer_reviews.author: P. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Zune 120
customer_reviews.text: This Zune is fantastic!!! Great screen for movies! No problems with connecting to computer. Software automatically updated and sync'd with my music flawlessly! I am going to buy a second one for my wife, she keeps taking mine! Anyone wanna buy a iPod?? Zune.net works great!
customer_reviews.author: Davy Crockett

customer_reviews.title: Better than the iPod
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my brother to replace his iPod when it died. He loves the bigger size (those iPods are so small you could lose them in your hand :) ) and Zune gives you more GB for your money. He absolutely loves his Zune-and I don't see him going back to iPod.
customer_reviews.author: K. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I wish these had done better
customer_reviews.text: Damn Apple driving all the other Mp3 players out of business. I love having a tuner on this. The memory capacity is awesome. Would like a little bit of an equalizer on it to adjust things a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Shively

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. The pricw is great too. The best thing is that you get to listen to as much music and watch as many podcasts that you want for less than 15 dollars a month. There is always going to be a problem with technology and the makers can not please everyone. Bottom line is that this is a great media player with great sound and great media storage capacity. To get better sound, I reccomend getting the premium headphones.
customer_reviews.author: M. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: ZUNE 120 GB PLAYER
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Zune or MP3 player. I really like this player because it is easy to use, download, and view. The Microsoft marketplace is a great site for finding videos, music and podcast. The podcast selection could be a little better but I think in time it should broaden.
customer_reviews.author: John S. Mynster

customer_reviews.title: It would not work even though it was new. ...
customer_reviews.text: It would not work even though it was new. Because my granddaughter (who is autistic) loves the redness of the unit, I am sending it to a repair shop in Texas for a $100++ repair. To have returned it would have caused a huge meltdown--and the purchase price I paid was quite outrageous for a broken product.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Center

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time on this
customer_reviews.text: Failed and died within 3 days. Never buy a used zune!!!
customer_reviews.author: D.B.

customer_reviews.title: Really Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought my Zune about a month ago and so far I totally love it. I like it much better than the Ipod. The software is stylish and easy to use and is much easier to customize than Itunes. The Zune itself is a bit bulkier than the Ipod, but I personally find the Ipod Classic really ugly so I like how the Zune looks. I also like the social aspect of the Zune a lot. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Megan R. Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Electrical Stuff on line
customer_reviews.text: This product never worked. I still have it in is box . Will never charge
customer_reviews.author: margaret

customer_reviews.title: Ipod Smypod!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my husband to travel to Europe with on the plane. HE LOVED IT. We have our array of ipods at home but I thought I'd give this product a try...he loved it. Unfortunately someone stole it from the airport security area...but my husband came home and ordered another one because he liked it so much!
customer_reviews.author: Ovi's mom

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied so far 3 weeks owner
customer_reviews.text: I quickly learned how to install some 1,375 songs in my unit which is great. I also purchased the Altec Lansing In Motion speaker system and a Car power system all of which covers all needs for a complete portable system. I am very happy with it all at this point!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Hadik

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these for $250 in hopes of it being better than an ipod classic but only after 3 months of use it got bricked and was unusable...another expensive paperweight i added to my collection...thank you microsoft for making an overpriced piece of crap! Would help if they would make these high capacity players solid state cause otherwise after a little use it doesn't work anymore...too late to send it back to get my money back...in conclusion do not buy this worthless thing!
customer_reviews.author: theiman1993

customer_reviews.title: Zoom Zoom Zune
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 120 GB Zune because I wanted a device that would store and play my digital music collection directly into my stero systems. The Zune and its associated home pack, which was a freebe, meet my needs very well. The Zune is esy to use and has much more capability than I am using currently. Its really nice to have instant access to all those songs instead of digging throug a pile of CDs.
customer_reviews.author: James Wasielewski

customer_reviews.title: Zune 120 Red
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE this mp3 player!! Also have an ipod 80gb...No comparison...This sounds clearer, has FM radio.. Also the Zune pass makes it wonderful!!I LOVE my Zune! Amazon had it to my door in 3 days with free UPS shipping!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: ipod killer
customer_reviews.text: Good item if you dont want to be a clone and just pick-up a ipod like everyone else. compared to the ipod classic i would say this is a winner, sound quallity it good and the the led screen makes vieos superb. excellent product the scroll however can use just a lil more work,but great item for its generation. 5 out of 5
customer_reviews.author: D. James

customer_reviews.title: I wish it would have come with a better instruction manual
customer_reviews.text: The screen had several scratches and the Zune itself has scratches and a few small dents. It was refurbished but it still came w/previous owners pictures and video games on it. I wish it would have come with a better instruction manual.
customer_reviews.author: terri covington

customer_reviews.title: Beats my old walkman
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for years and still haven't begun to reach its capacity. I think I get 8-9 hours on a two hour charge.
customer_reviews.author: none

customer_reviews.title: Zune at 120G - a good buy
customer_reviews.text: I have the 80G Zune and this is the same but at a bigger capacity. Slight problem however with the link with the computer which is slower than syncing with the 80G. Price wise it could be cheaper with prices of hard disk dropping.
customer_reviews.author: David Chiang

customer_reviews.title: So far so awesome
customer_reviews.text: Ive had an iPod Nano(8gb) and a iPod Video(30gb) before. Compared to those 2 items, this Zune is in a whole nother level. So far the battery life is great, the picture is crystal clear. I love watching movies on it.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Johns

customer_reviews.title: Zune 120 GB
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product and for the price of smaller capacity Zunes the value is better. For younger children it might be too much GB, but for people who love music and movies and have time to fill it up this is a great item.
customer_reviews.author: NatalieJT

customer_reviews.title: Had this now for 7 months and the only problem ...
customer_reviews.text: Had this now for 7 months and the only problem I have out of it is the headphone jack is somehow loose. If you turn the headphone cord a certain way, it stops playing music. But for being an obsolete MP3 player, you can't really complain too much.
customer_reviews.author: Blaire Allen

customer_reviews.title: Was excited to get this. when it arrived, ...
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to get this. when it arrived, I loaded music on it and then the hard drive broke before I had a chance to use. Waiting to see how the seller remedies this. Still think I want it even though I have an ipod classic.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grea product.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a month now. I really like it. The video quality is great (when you convert videos to use the H264 codec) and mp3 sound quality is great. The Zune software is ok at best. Some things I should mention is only the Zune software works with managing the Zune. You can't use Windows or Winamp or iTunes. Also when I bought this off Amazon I paid $220 for it. The date of this review, I see that the price is at $339.99. Either these things are really in demand, or Microsoft/Amazon is purposely trying to get you to buy the Zune HD models.
customer_reviews.author: J. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Disc or link needed
customer_reviews.text: I need a disc or link to download music from my computer to the Zune mp3 player. Microsofts link does not work currently. Please help
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: After much paining over whether to get an ipod classic or a zune, I went with the Zune. This tiny 120 GB box is fantastic! I like the zune software, FM radio, wireless sync with PC. I can't believe I have my entire 230+ cd collection and still have over 100 GB remaining for movies, pictures and video.
customer_reviews.author: J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT TIL YOUR COMPUTER ZUNE PROGRAM CRASHES
customer_reviews.text: i HAVE 3 ZUNE PLAYER ALL REALLY WORK, IT'S JUST THE COMPUTER PROGRAM FOR ZUNE CRASHED ON BOTH MY COMPUTER THAT RUN WITH WINDOWS XP. TRY AS YOU MIGHT YOU WILL NOT GET THE PROGRAM TO WORK AGAIN YOU CAN NOT ERASE THE OLD ONE AND NOTHING HELPS. SO I AM BUYING A NEW COMPUTER JUST TO RUN ZUNE( GOOD TRICK MICROSOFT). IF YOU DO HAVE ZUNE WORKING NEVER UPLOAD UPGRADES FOR ZUNE. I EXPECT A FIX FOR THIS PROBLEM BUT SEE FOR YOURSELF THERE HAS BEEN NONE FOR YEARS!!!
customer_reviews.author: T. R Parry

customer_reviews.title: No Equalizer?!
customer_reviews.text: Come on guys, my old 30 gig had equalizer customization. They think all music sounds the best when it's tinny and has no body? What the hell were they thinking? Boo, Microsoft. -Rob
customer_reviews.author: R. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: The zune is my second favorite maker of MP3 players. But since my favorite brand no longer makes large capacity music players, I will take this one!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Zune 120GB Player
customer_reviews.text: Love this player. It has everything you could want, it's easy to use, and you can put practically your whole computer on it. My only problem with this player is the headphones that came in the package .... they are not good at all. I switched to a cheap pair of JVC's and the sound is amazing. Battery lasts a very long time ... I work 12 hours a day and I have this player on virtually the whole time and still have half of a battery when the day is done. Well worth the price except for the cheap headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Gary M. Maiorana

customer_reviews.title: Zune
customer_reviews.text: My grandson was thrilled to receive this for Christmas. His original one was stolen at gun point a year ago. Service was great; arrived on time and in good condition. Thanks so much.............
customer_reviews.author: Hedge

customer_reviews.title: An Alternative to the IPod
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is poor but the display is fine and it is big/small enough to watch a film on. A good backup to the IPod which I prefer.
customer_reviews.author: PJJ Ryan

customer_reviews.title: A Good Player at a Good Price
customer_reviews.text: I have had a 30 MB Zune for just under two years and thought I would try the larger model. I find the controls on the 120 MB are more sensitive and the case does not appear as rugged as the older model however the screen is better so on balance its a good buy
customer_reviews.author: Paul Archer

customer_reviews.title: Zune 120 GB
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my Zune 80GB. Way much thinner that the 80GB and the transfer was very simple. I was able to upgrade to more storage.
customer_reviews.author: luboy680

customer_reviews.title: it was doing so good was work and the gym but nope
customer_reviews.text: dude on the 3rd day it just shut off ,it was doing so good at work and the gym but nope!
customer_reviews.author: Derick

customer_reviews.title: Zune 120GB: better portability and sound...
customer_reviews.text: I had a 30GB Zune and never had trouble with it, but now with the Zune 120GB, my mp3 experiencie is way much better. Its design is more slick and easier to handle, it works faster and it is more user friendly. Great!
customer_reviews.author: P. LEON

customer_reviews.title: Zune 120gb music Player
customer_reviews.text: After paying $399.00 for this Zune last year in January 2014 it just stopped working last week stating it could not interface with the computer. Now it will not even turn on. This is the second device I have purchased that has done this. Because of the cost and the resultant inability of the Zune devices I will be switching to an IPod. I will have to figure out how to change all my music to ITunes. I would advise not to purchase a Zune product as the reliability is definitely suspect! Plus there is no support available to get the device repaired.
customer_reviews.author: SGMCAM

product_meta.title: Zune 120 GB Video MP3 Player (Black)
product_meta.description: Color:Black/Black| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingMassive capacity in a deluxe device that delivers uncompromised audio and video quality, the Zune 120 GB can fit a huge collection and still have room for videos, podcasts, and more. This major player hooks up with innovative discovery features like Buy from FM and wireless sharing, so you never stop gobbling tunes. It holds up to 30,000 songs, 25,000 pictures, or 375 hours of video. Watch a demo on Zune.
feature_bullets: IMPORTANT: Allow your Zune to charge for 30 minutes then disconnect and reconnect the cable to turn on the player
Listen to your favorite FM radio stations and click to tag the songs you like for later purchase when you sync your device with your PC
Download millions of tracks, whole albums, or playlists with the Zune Pass subscription service; extend your subscription online or by purchasing a Zune Pass card
Connect to your home wireless network and remotely sync your Zune device with your PC collection from your dock, AC adapter, or speaker dock accessory
120 GB capacity for up to 30,000 songs, 25,000 photos, or 375 hours of video
3.2-inch color LCD with 320 x 240 pixel display resolution

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars722 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
